title: Dylan Bartlett's body found in a toilet air-duct after he was missing for seven weeks
text:
The search for a 23-year-old who had been missing for seven weeks has ended in tragedy.

The body of Dylan Bartlett was found in a shopping centre toilet block air-duct on Monday at 4.40pm in southern Adelaide.

Police identified the body as belonging to the young man in a statement on Wednesday.

The body of Dylan Bartlett (pictured) was found in a shopping centre toilet block air-duct on Monday at 4.40pm in southern Adelaide

South Australia Police said they are unsure why Mr Bartlett's body was in the air-duct.

However, they are not treating the death as suspicious.

Mr Bartlett's stepfather Troy Wisman was seen laying flowers at the scene.

'Yesterday I got a phone call and that was it, he was found,' he told Nine News.

He broke down in tears as he continued to speak of his stepson.

Mr Bartlett's body was found in an air-duct (pictured) after he was missing for seven weeks

Mr Bartlett's stepfather Troy Wisman (pictured) was seen laying flowers at the sight of where the 23-year-old's body was found

'I don't think he was trying to break in, I think he was hiding,' Mr Wisman said.

He said that was just his opinion and the investigation is ongoing.

A report is being prepared for the coroner.
description: Dylan Bartlett had been missing for seven weeks. His body was found on Monday in the air-duct of a toilet at a shopping centre in south Adelaide. Police are not treating his death as suspicious.
authors: Claudia Poposki For Daily Mail Australia
